string-array.name: spirit_importance
string-array.item: While at competitions it\'s important that you make your team known. The more noticed you are by other teams, the more likely you are to get picked for alliance selections. You also want to keep the competition energy high because it makes an even more exciting atmosphere for everyone in the arena.

string-array.name: spirit_team_image
string-array.item:
Before competition it is important to develop a team image or look. This look can be fun and exciting; teams wear everything from animal costumes to capes and crowns, each team coming up with their own look. It can be difficult to make your own image, but just keep in mind that it doesn\'t have to be crazy to be recognizable. As winners of the FIRST World Championship Imagery Award, KING TeC shows that you don’t have to look over the top for your team to stand out.
Start with a team t-shirt. Make your team name and number easily read, this way if another team or a judge is looking for your team, you’re easy to find. After developing a shirt, the sky is the limit. Teams wear everything from matching shoes, to matching bracelets. Be creative and remember to not shy far from your name. If teams will wonder how your mascot is relevant to your name, it’s probably not the best idea.

string-array.name: spirit_swag
string-array.item: Swag is a giveaway item for other teams. Although swag is far from mandatory, it can help advertise your team. Many teams do buttons, while at competition you can see people completely covered in buttons. Other simple and cost effective ideas are pencils and bracelets. Swag gets your team name and number out to other teams. Continue to keep in mind your message, your image, and how you want other teams to remember you.
